TopicTitle: Some weird message in Danny's new video?

Articles.Content:
So Danny just released a new YouTube video today. It's only 12 seconds long, and all it has in it is flashes of the claw and a weird contraption, then at the end it says "HIDDEN POWER" and afterwards "T-5." From what I've guessed, and what most of the comments say, is that t-5 is a countdown to something. But what? And how long? 5 hours? Days? To me this has .25 written all over it.

Edit: Here's the link: http://youtu.be/-YKSnPYh_nE

Edited September 25, 2014 by Yellowburn10
If he's "in the know" by being in QA, Experimentals, or the Media Team, then my guess would be that it's 5 days, meaning 0.25 is coming Tuesday (if all goes to plan).
I took the liberty if screencapping those scenes so we can analyze it like the "Rowsdower image"

I think it's much more likely he's found a new glitch/bug he can abuse with the claw, and the video about it will be uploaded on Tuesday... Do you really think he'd be allowed to release info on the upcoming 0.25 release when the devs haven't?
At least it would make sense for the release to be next tuesday, considering the time V 0.25 is in experimental and the usual habit of squad to (try to) release on tuesdays

Yeah, I think it's a teaser trailer for a new video. 5 hours or 5 days, I'm not sure but I'm fairly certain he wouldn't post even vague hints about 0.25 as they would be against his NDA and I know squad is not going to clear the Media team until after Squadcast.

my first instincts were the t-5 was countdown to .25 (as that would be Tuesday), but as others noted, unless they've specifically approved what he's doing, it would be somewhat unusual for it to be that. I'm more leaning towards a new project of his. And god knows what type of contraption he's constructed.
We have to remember that we are dealing with people with a background in marketing - so all this viral-like bits we are getting ... I really like it. ^^
I hope it is T-5 days till release of 0.25!

Yeah, I think it's a teaser trailer for a new video. 5 hours or 5 days, I'm not sure but I'm fairly certain he wouldn't post even vague hints about 0.25 as they would be against his NDA and I know squad is not going to clear the Media team until after Squadcast.

True that. I didn't think it through.
New glitch propulsion for asteroids based on slightly misaligned claws?

Does anyone here actually read his Twitter? It's a teaser video for some sort of "glitch device". We all know how glitchy the claw is, so this is going to be AWESOME

Edited September 25, 2014 by Nikola7007
im so gud at gramr and speeling
New Kraken drive
5 days. Pretty sure.
It means he's releasing his video about the glitched claw in five days. It's on his Twitter page, I'm pretty sure.

Oh no... Danny is going to abuse the Klaw...

That thing might just be the single most concentrated point of bugginess in KSP.

Seriously... Weird things happen when you use it

Wow, some of you are as bad as those people that make the Half Life 3 Confirmed jokes... Danny's username has a 2 in it, and the video has a 5 in it: 0.25 confirmed!

CALM DOWN PEOPLE. The less you think about 0.25, the quicker it will arrive... As old engrish proverb say:

A watched kettle never boils!

New Kraken drive

Yep, this is my guess too. And T-5 is the countdown to his new video explaining what it is or how it works.
His channel is very close to 100,000 subs, maybe Tuesday is the day he thinks it will get there?
In that image... it looks like he's intersected a ladder with the claw... Undoubtedly the glitch involves extreme Kerbal Abuse
I think it's just something else to make everyone on the forum go crazy. The devs and anyone else involved are all laughing at the people on the forum....

To me, it looks like the video will be about a new-and-improved Kraken drive. Maybe he'll get to Eeloo in 11 hours?

It most likely won't be a 0.25 video, as that would be a breach of the NDA. Plus, like other "First time in 0.xx" videos, he'd mess around with the new features. It wouldn't make sense for him to showcase a bug in 0.25 experimentals that may well have been stomped by release.
